senses.sense_definition: An action, process, or method that is not direct or straightforward.

examples.text: He preferred to approach the sensitive topic through <w>indirection</w> rather than asking plainly.
The author reveals the character's motives by <w>indirection</w> throughout the novel.

senses.sense_definition: The use of an address or reference to access data instead of accessing the value directly.

examples.text: Adding a level of <w>indirection</w> can help decouple the software components.
Pointers in programming are a common form of <w>indirection</w> used to manage memory.

senses.sense_definition: Deceitful or evasive behavior; a lack of honest direction or aim.

examples.text: The politician was criticized for his <w>indirection</w> when answering questions about the scandal.
She was tired of the <w>indirection</w> and demanded a clear and honest answer.
